          {
            "name": "BusStopList.tsx",
            "type": "file",
            "content": "import { useBusStops } from \"../../lib/BusStopContext\"\nimport BusStopItem from \"./BusStopItem\"\n\ninterface BusStopListProps {\n  sortBy: \"nearest\" | \"soonest\"\n  onSelectStop: (stop: any) => void\n}\n\nexport default function BusStopList({ sortBy, onSelectStop }: BusStopListProps) {\n  const { filteredStops, loading, error, userLocation } = useBusStops()\n\n  if (loading) return <div>Loading stations...</div>\n  if (error) return <div>Error: {error}</div>\n\n  // Sort stops based on sortBy\n  const sortedStops = [...filteredStops].sort((a, b) => {\n    if (sortBy === \"nearest\" && userLocation) {\n      const distanceA = calculateDistance(\n        userLocation.latitude,\n        userLocation.longitude,\n        Number.parseFloat(a.lat),\n        Number.parseFloat(a.lon),\n      )\n      const distanceB = calculateDistance(\n        userLocation.latitude,\n        userLocation.longitude,\n        Number.parseFloat(b.lat),\n        Number.parseFloat(b.lon),\n      )\n      return distanceA - distanceB\n    } else {\n      // This is a placeholder. In reality, you'd need to fetch and compare actual next bus times.\n      return Math.random() - 0.5\n    }\n  })\n\n  return (\n    <ul className=\"space-y-4\">\n      {sortedStops.map((stop) => (\n        <BusStopItem\n          key={stop.stopId}\n          stop={stop}\n          sortBy={sortBy}\n          onSelectStop={onSelectStop}\n          userLocation={userLocation}\n        />\n      ))}\n    </ul>\n  )\n}\n\nfunction calculateDistance(lat1: number, lon1: number, lat2: number, lon2: number): number {\n  const R = 6371 // Radius of the earth in km\n  const dLat = deg2rad(lat2 - lat1)\n  const dLon = deg2rad(lon2 - lon1)\n  const a =\n    Math.sin(dLat / 2) * Math.sin(dLat / 2) +\n    Math.cos(deg2rad(lat1)) * Math.cos(deg2rad(lat2)) * Math.sin(dLon / 2) * Math.sin(dLon / 2)\n  const c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a))\n  const d = R * c // Distance in km\n  return d\n}\n\nfunction deg2rad(deg: number): number {\n  return deg * (Math.PI / 180)\n}\n\n"
          },
          {
            "name": "AllStations.tsx",
            "type": "file",
            "content": "\"use client\"\n\nimport { useState, useEffect } from \"react\"\nimport { filterStopsByName, filterStopsByRoute, type BusStop } from \"../../lib/busStopService\"\nimport { useBusStops } from \"../../lib/BusStopContext\"\nimport { Input } from \"@/components/ui/input\"\n\nexport default function AllStations() {\n  const { filteredStops, loading, error } = useBusStops()\n  const [displayedStops, setDisplayedStops] = useState<BusStop[]>([])\n  const [nameFilter, setNameFilter] = useState(\"\")\n  const [routeFilter, setRouteFilter] = useState(\"\")\n\n  useEffect(() => {\n    let result = filteredStops\n    if (nameFilter) {\n      result = filterStopsByName(result, nameFilter)\n    }\n    if (routeFilter) {\n      result = filterStopsByRoute(result, routeFilter)\n    }\n    setDisplayedStops(result)\n  }, [filteredStops, nameFilter, routeFilter])\n\n  if (loading) return <div>Loading stations...</div>\n  if (error) return <div>Error: {error}</div>\n\n  return (\n    <div className=\"space-y-4\">\n      <h2 className=\"text-2xl font-bold\">All Bus Stations</h2>\n      <div className=\"flex gap-2 flex-wrap\">\n        <Input\n          type=\"text\"\n          placeholder=\"Filter by name\"\n          value={nameFilter}\n          onChange={(e) => setNameFilter(e.target.value)}\n          className=\"flex-grow\"\n        />\n        <Input\n          type=\"text\"\n          placeholder=\"Filter by route\"\n          value={routeFilter}\n          onChange={(e) => setRouteFilter(e.target.value)}\n          className=\"flex-grow\"\n        />\n      </div>\n      <div>Total stations: {displayedStops.length}</div>\n      <ul className=\"space-y-2\">\n        {displayedStops.map((stop) => (\n          <li key={stop.stopId} className=\"border rounded p-2\">\n            <h3 className=\"font-semibold\">{stop.name}</h3>\n            <p className=\"text-sm text-gray-600\">ID: {stop.stopId}</p>\n            <p className=\"text-sm text-gray-600\">Location: {stop.ubica}</p>\n            <p className=\"text-sm text-gray-600\">Routes: {stop.routes.map((route) => route.SN).join(\", \")}</p>\n          </li>\n        ))}\n      </ul>\n    </div>\n  )\n}\n\n"

            "content": "import { Button } from \"@/components/ui/button\"\n\ninterface SortToggleProps {\n  sortBy: \"nearest\" | \"soonest\"\n  onSortChange: (sortBy: \"nearest\" | \"soonest\") => void\n}\n\nexport default function SortToggle({ sortBy, onSortChange }: SortToggleProps) {\n  return (\n    <div className=\"flex gap-2 mb-4\">\n      <Button onClick={() => onSortChange(\"nearest\")} variant={sortBy === \"nearest\" ? \"default\" : \"outline\"}>\n        Nearest\n      </Button>\n      <Button onClick={() => onSortChange(\"soonest\")} variant={sortBy === \"soonest\" ? \"default\" : \"outline\"}>\n        Soonest\n      </Button>\n    </div>\n  )\n}\n\n"

            "content": "import { useState } from \"react\"\nimport { Button } from \"@/components/ui/button\"\nimport { Input } from \"@/components/ui/input\"\n\ninterface SearchBarProps {\n  onSearch: (query: string) => void\n  onUseMyLocation: () => void\n}\n\nexport default function SearchBar({ onSearch, onUseMyLocation }: SearchBarProps) {\n  const [query, setQuery] = useState(\"\")\n\n  const handleSubmit = (e: React.FormEvent) => {\n    e.preventDefault()\n    onSearch(query)\n  }\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit} className=\"flex gap-2 mb-4\">\n      <Input\n        type=\"text\"\n        placeholder=\"Enter location...\"\n        value={query}\n        onChange={(e) => setQuery(e.target.value)}\n        className=\"flex-grow\"\n      />\n      <Button type=\"submit\">Search</Button>\n      <Button type=\"button\" onClick={onUseMyLocation} variant=\"outline\">\n        Use My Location\n      </Button>\n    </form>\n  )\n}\n\n"

          {
            "name": "BusArrivalInfo.tsx",
            "type": "file",
            "content": "\"use client\"\n\nimport { useState, useEffect, useCallback } from \"react\"\nimport { Button } from \"@/components/ui/button\"\n\ninterface Bus {\n  line: string\n  minutes: string\n}\n\ninterface BusArrivalInfoProps {\n  stopId: string\n}\n\nexport default function BusArrivalInfo({ stopId }: BusArrivalInfoProps) {\n  const [buses, setBuses] = useState<Bus[]>([])\n  const [loading, setLoading] = useState(false)\n  const [error, setError] = useState<string | null>(null)\n\n  const fetchData = useCallback(async () => {\n    setLoading(true)\n    setError(null)\n\n    try {\n      const url = `https://geoportal.emtvalencia.es/EMT/mapfunctions/MapUtilsPetitions.php?sec=getSAE&parada=${stopId}&adaptados=false&idioma=va&nocache=${Math.random()}`\n      console.log(`Fetching data for stop ${stopId} from URL: ${url}`)\n\n      const response = await fetch(url)\n\n      if (!response.ok) {\n        throw new Error(`HTTP Error: ${response.status}`)\n      }\n\n      const xml = await response.text()\n      console.log(`Received XML for stop ${stopId}:`, xml)\n\n      const results = parseXml(xml)\n      console.log(`Parsed results for stop ${stopId}:`, results)\n\n      setBuses(results)\n    } catch (error) {\n      console.error(`Error fetching data for stop ${stopId}:`, error)\n      setError(`Error: ${error instanceof Error ? error.message : \"Unknown error\"}`)\n    } finally {\n      setLoading(false)\n    }\n  }, [stopId])\n\n  useEffect(() => {\n    fetchData()\n  }, [fetchData])\n\n  function parseXml(xml: string): Bus[] {\n    const busBlocks = xml.match(/<bus>[\\s\\S]*?<\\/bus>/g) || []\n    console.log(`Found ${busBlocks.length} bus blocks in XML for stop ${stopId}`)\n\n    const results: Bus[] = []\n\n    for (const block of busBlocks) {\n      const lineaMatch = block.match(/<linea>([^<]+)<\\/linea>/)\n      const minutosMatch = block.match(/<minutos>([^<]+)<\\/minutos>/)\n\n      if (lineaMatch && minutosMatch) {\n        results.push({\n          line: lineaMatch[1],\n          minutes: minutosMatch[1],\n        })\n      } else {\n        console.warn(`Incomplete bus data in XML block for stop ${stopId}:`, block)\n      }\n    }\n\n    return results\n  }\n\n  if (loading) return <div>Loading bus arrival information...</div>\n  if (error) return <div>{error}</div>\n\n  return (\n    <div className=\"mt-2\">\n      <h4 className=\"text-sm font-semibold mb-1\">Next Buses:</h4>\n      {buses.length > 0 ? (\n        <ul className=\"space-y-1\">\n          {buses.map((bus, index) => (\n            <li key={index} className=\"text-sm\">\n              BUS {bus.line} - {bus.minutes} minutes\n            </li>\n          ))}\n        </ul>\n      ) : (\n        <p className=\"text-sm text-gray-500\">No buses found for this stop</p>\n      )}\n      <Button onClick={fetchData} className=\"mt-2 text-xs py-1 px-2\">\n        Refresh\n      </Button>\n    </div>\n  )\n}\n\n"
          },
          {
            "name": "BusStopItem.tsx",
            "type": "file",
            "content": "\"use client\"\n\nimport { useState, useEffect, useRef } from \"react\"\nimport { Button } from \"@/components/ui/button\"\nimport BusArrivalInfo from \"./BusArrivalInfo\"\n\ninterface BusStopItemProps {\n  stop: any\n  sortBy: \"nearest\" | \"soonest\"\n  onSelectStop: (stop: any) => void\n  userLocation: { latitude: number; longitude: number } | null\n}\n\nexport default function BusStopItem({ stop, sortBy, onSelectStop, userLocation }: BusStopItemProps) {\n  const [isVisible, setIsVisible] = useState(false)\n  const ref = useRef<HTMLLIElement>(null)\n\n  useEffect(() => {\n    const observer = new IntersectionObserver(\n      ([entry]) => {\n        if (entry.isIntersecting) {\n          setIsVisible(true)\n          observer.unobserve(entry.target)\n        }\n      },\n      {\n        root: null,\n        rootMargin: \"0px\",\n        threshold: 0.1,\n      },\n    )\n\n    if (ref.current) {\n      observer.observe(ref.current)\n    }\n\n    return () => {\n      if (ref.current) {\n        observer.unobserve(ref.current)\n      }\n    }\n  }, [])\n\n  function calculateDistance(lat1: number, lon1: number, lat2: number, lon2: number): number {\n    const R = 6371 // Radius of the earth in km\n    const dLat = deg2rad(lat2 - lat1)\n    const dLon = deg2rad(lon2 - lon1)\n    const a =\n      Math.sin(dLat / 2) * Math.sin(dLat / 2) +\n      Math.cos(deg2rad(lat1)) * Math.cos(deg2rad(lat2)) * Math.sin(dLon / 2) * Math.sin(dLon / 2)\n    const c = 2 * Math.atan2(Math.sqrt(a), Math.sqrt(1 - a))\n    const d = R * c // Distance in km\n    return d\n  }\n\n  function deg2rad(deg: number): number {\n    return deg * (Math.PI / 180)\n  }\n\n  return (\n    <li ref={ref} className=\"border rounded p-4\">\n      <div className=\"flex justify-between items-center mb-2\">\n        <span className=\"font-semibold\">{stop.name}</span>\n        <Button onClick={() => onSelectStop(stop)} variant=\"ghost\">\n          View Details\n        </Button>\n      </div>\n      <div className=\"text-sm text-gray-600 mb-2\">\n        {sortBy === \"nearest\" && userLocation\n          ? `Distance: ${calculateDistance(\n              userLocation.latitude,\n              userLocation.longitude,\n              Number.parseFloat(stop.lat),\n              Number.parseFloat(stop.lon),\n            ).toFixed(2)} km`\n          : `Next bus: TBD`}\n      </div>\n      {isVisible && <BusArrivalInfo stopId={stop.stopId} />}\n    </li>\n  )\n}\n\n"
          },

        "name": "page.tsx",
        "type": "file",
        "content": "\"use client\"\n\nimport { useState, useEffect } from \"react\"\nimport { mockBusStops, sortBusStops, type BusStop } from \"../lib/mockData\"\nimport SearchBar from \"./components/SearchBar\"\nimport SortToggle from \"./components/SortToggle\"\nimport BusStopList from \"./components/BusStopList\"\nimport BusStopDetail from \"./components/BusStopDetail\"\nimport AllStations from \"./components/AllStations\"\nimport { Button } from \"@/components/ui/button\"\nimport { BusStopProvider, useBusStops } from \"../lib/BusStopContext\"\nimport { Select, SelectContent, SelectItem, SelectTrigger, SelectValue } from \"@/components/ui/select\"\n\nfunction HomeContent() {\n  const [sortBy, setSortBy] = useState<\"nearest\" | \"soonest\">(\"nearest\")\n  const [selectedStop, setSelectedStop] = useState<BusStop | null>(null)\n  const [showAllStations, setShowAllStations] = useState(false)\n  const { setUserLocation, setDistanceFilter } = useBusStops()\n\n  useEffect(() => {\n    if (\"geolocation\" in navigator) {\n      navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(\n        (position) => {\n          setUserLocation({\n            latitude: position.coords.latitude,\n            longitude: position.coords.longitude,\n          })\n        },\n        (error) => {\n          console.error(\"Error getting user location:\", error)\n        },\n      )\n    } else {\n      console.log(\"Geolocation is not available in this browser.\")\n    }\n  }, [setUserLocation])\n\n  const handleSearch = (query: string) => {\n    console.log(\"Searching for:\", query)\n    // Implement search functionality here\n  }\n\n  const handleUseMyLocation = () => {\n    if (\"geolocation\" in navigator) {\n      navigator.geolocation.getCurrentPosition(\n        (position) => {\n          setUserLocation({\n            latitude: position.coords.latitude,\n            longitude: position.coords.longitude,\n          })\n        },\n        (error) => {\n          console.error(\"Error getting user location:\", error)\n        },\n      )\n    } else {\n      console.log(\"Geolocation is not available in this browser.\")\n    }\n  }\n\n  const handleSortChange = (newSortBy: \"nearest\" | \"soonest\") => {\n    setSortBy(newSortBy)\n  }\n\n  const handleDistanceFilterChange = (value: string) => {\n    setDistanceFilter(Number.parseFloat(value))\n  }\n\n  return (\n    <main className=\"max-w-4xl mx-auto p-4\">\n      <h1 className=\"text-2xl font-bold mb-4\">Bus Stop Finder</h1>\n      {showAllStations ? (\n        <>\n          <Button onClick={() => setShowAllStations(false)} className=\"mb-4\">\n            Back to Nearby Stops\n          </Button>\n          <AllStations />\n        </>\n      ) : (\n        <>\n          <SearchBar onSearch={handleSearch} onUseMyLocation={handleUseMyLocation} />\n          <div className=\"flex justify-between items-center mb-4\">\n            <SortToggle sortBy={sortBy} onSortChange={handleSortChange} />\n            <Select onValueChange={handleDistanceFilterChange}>\n              <SelectTrigger className=\"w-[180px]\">\n                <SelectValue placeholder=\"Filter by distance\" />\n              </SelectTrigger>\n              <SelectContent>\n                <SelectItem value=\"0.1\">100 meters</SelectItem>\n                <SelectItem value=\"0.5\">500 meters</SelectItem>\n                <SelectItem value=\"1\">1 kilometer</SelectItem>\n                <SelectItem value=\"Infinity\">All stations</SelectItem>\n              </SelectContent>\n            </Select>\n          </div>\n          <Button onClick={() => setShowAllStations(true)} className=\"mb-4\">\n            View All Stations\n          </Button>\n          <BusStopList sortBy={sortBy} onSelectStop={setSelectedStop} />\n          {selectedStop && <BusStopDetail stop={selectedStop} onClose={() => setSelectedStop(null)} />}\n        </>\n      )}\n    </main>\n  )\n}\n\nexport default function Home() {\n  return (\n    <BusStopProvider>\n      <HomeContent />\n    </BusStopProvider>\n  )\n}\n\n"

useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { z } from 'zod';\nimport { zodResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = z.object({\n  username: z.string().nonempty({ message: USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n  password: z.string().nonempty({ message: PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n});\n\ntype FormData = z.infer<typeof schema>;\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: zodResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Zod\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField 'computed-types';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { computedTypesResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = Schema({\n  username: string.min(2).error(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  password: string.min(2).error(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Type<typeof schema> & { unusedProperty: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: computedTypesResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with computed-types\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

'computed-types';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { computedTypesResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = Schema({\n  username: string.min(2).error('username field is required'),\n  password: string.min(2).error('password field is required'),\n  address: Schema({\n    zipCode: string.min(5).max(5).error('zipCode field is required'),\n  }),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Type<typeof schema> & { unusedProperty: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const {\n    register,\n    handleSubmit,\n    formState: { errors },\n  } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: computedTypesResolver(schema), // Useful to check TypeScript regressions\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} />\n      {errors.username && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.username.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('password')} />\n      {errors.password && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.password.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('address.zipCode')} />\n      {errors.address?.zipCode && (\n        <span role=\"alert\">{errors.address.zipCode.message}</span>\n      )}\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's validation with computed-types and TypeScript's integration\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  expect(screen.queryAllByRole('alert')).toHaveLength(0);\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  expect(screen.getByText(/username field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(screen.getByText(/password field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(screen.getByText(/zipCode field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(handleSubmit).not.toHaveBeenCalled();\n});\n"

from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { joiResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = Joi.object({\n  username: Joi.string().required(),\n  password: Joi.string().required(),\n});\n\ninterface FormData {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: joiResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Joi\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    '\"username\" is not allowed to be empty',\n  );\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    '\"password\" is not allowed to be empty',\n  );\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as                                         "content": "import { Static, Type } from '@sinclair/typebox';\nimport { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { typeboxResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = Type.Object({\n  username: Type.String({ minLength: 1 }),\n  password: Type.String({ minLength: 1 }),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Static<typeof schema> & { unusedProperty: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const {\n    register,\n    handleSubmit,\n    formState: { errors },\n  } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: typeboxResolver(schema), // Useful to check TypeScript regressions\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} />\n      {errors.username && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.username.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('password')} />\n      {errors.password && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.password.message}</span>}\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's validation with Typebox and TypeScript's integration\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  expect(screen.queryAllByRole('alert')).toHaveLength(0);\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  expect(\n    screen.getAllByText(/Expected string length greater or equal to 1/i),\n  ).toHaveLength(2);\n\n  expect(handleSubmit).not.toHaveBeenCalled();\n});\n"

                                  }

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport vine from '@vinejs/vine';\nimport { Infer } from '@vinejs/vine/build/src/types';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { vineResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = vine.compile(\n  vine.object({\n    username: vine.string().minLength(1),\n    password: vine.string().minLength(1),\n  }),\n);\n\ntype FormData = Infer<typeof schema> & { unusedProperty: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: vineResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Zod\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'The username field must have at least 1 characters',\n  );\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'The password field must have at least 1 characters',\n  );\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },

                                      }

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { Infer, object, size, string } from 'superstruct';\nimport { superstructResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = object({\n  username: size(string(), 2),\n  password: size(string(), 6),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Infer<typeof schema>;\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: superstructResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Superstruct\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'Expected a string with a length of `2` but received one with a length of `0`',\n  );\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'Expected a string with a length of `6` but received one with a length of `0`',\n  );\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'jo');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'passwo');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { Schema } from 'effect';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { effectTsResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = Schema.Struct({\n  username: Schema.String.pipe(\n    Schema.nonEmptyString({ message: () => USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n  ),\n  password: Schema.String.pipe(\n    Schema.nonEmptyString({ message: () => PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n  ),\n});\n\ninterface FormData {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: effectTsResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with effect-ts\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },

                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport * as t from 'typanion';\nimport { typanionResolver } from '..';\n\nconst ERROR_MESSAGE =\n  'Expected to have a length of at least 1 elements (got 0)';\n\nconst schema = t.isObject({\n  username: t.applyCascade(t.isString(), [t.hasMinLength(1)]),\n  password: t.applyCascade(t.isString(), [t.hasMinLength(1)]),\n});\n\ninterface FormData {\n  unusedProperty: string;\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: typanionResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Typanion\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(ERROR_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(ERROR_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport Nope from 'nope-validator';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { nopeResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = Nope.object().shape({\n  username: Nope.string().required(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  password: Nope.string().required(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n});\n\ninterface FormData {\n  unusedProperty: string;\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: nopeResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Nope\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport * as Yup from 'yup';\nimport { yupResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = Yup.object({\n  username: Yup.string().required(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  password: Yup.string().required(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Yup.InferType<typeof schema>;\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: yupResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Yup\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                  }

'@typeschema/main';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { z } from 'zod';\nimport { typeschemaResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = z.object({\n  username: z.string().min(1, { message: USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n  password: z.string().min(1, { message: PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE }),\n});\n\ntype FormData = Infer<typeof schema>;\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: typeschemaResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with TypeSchema\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { IsNotEmpty } from 'class-validator';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { SubmitHandler, useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { classValidatorResolver } from '..';\n\nclass Schema {\n  @IsNotEmpty()\n  username: string;\n\n  @IsNotEmpty()\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: SubmitHandler<Schema>;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<Schema>({\n    resolver: classValidatorResolver(Schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Class Validator\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('username should not be empty');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('password should not be empty');\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport * as v from 'valibot';\nimport { valibotResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is v.required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is v.required';\n\nconst schema = v.object({\n  username: v.pipe(\n    v.string(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n    v.minLength(2, USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  ),\n  password: v.pipe(\n    v.string(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n    v.minLength(2, PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  ),\n});\n\ntype FormData = { username: string; password: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: valibotResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Valibot\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },
                                      {
                                        "name": "__snapshots__",
                                        "type": "directory",
                                        "children": []

                                        "name": "Form.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport * as v from 'valibot';\nimport { valibotResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = v.object({\n  username: v.pipe(\n    v.string(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n    v.minLength(2, USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  ),\n  password: v.pipe(\n    v.string(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n    v.minLength(2, PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  ),\n});\n\ntype FormData = { username: string; password: string };\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const {\n    register,\n    handleSubmit,\n    formState: { errors },\n  } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: valibotResolver(schema), // Useful to check TypeScript regressions\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} />\n      {errors.username && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.username.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('password')} />\n      {errors.password && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.password.message}</span>}\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's validation with Valibot and TypeScript's integration\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  expect(screen.queryAllByRole('alert')).toHaveLength(0);\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  expect(screen.getByText(/username field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(screen.getByText(/password field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(handleSubmit).not.toHaveBeenCalled();\n});\n"
                                      }
                                    ]
                                  }
                                ]
                              }
                            ]

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { type } from 'arktype';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { arktypeResolver } from '..';\n\nconst schema = type({\n  username: 'string>1',\n  password: 'string>1',\n});\n\ntype FormData = typeof schema.infer;\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: arktypeResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Zod\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'username must be more than length 1',\n  );\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(\n    'password must be more than length 1',\n  );\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "name": "Form-native-validation.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { Validator } from 'fluentvalidation-ts';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { fluentValidationResolver } from '../fluentvalidation-ts';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\ntype FormData = {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n};\n\nclass FormDataValidator extends Validator<FormData> {\n  constructor() {\n    super();\n\n    this.ruleFor('username').notEmpty().withMessage(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n    this.ruleFor('password').notEmpty().withMessage(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n  }\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: fluentValidationResolver(new FormDataValidator()),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with fluentvalidation-ts\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },

                                        "name": "Form.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { Validator } from 'fluentvalidation-ts';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { SubmitHandler, useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { fluentValidationResolver } from '../fluentvalidation-ts';\n\ntype FormData = {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n};\n\nclass FormDataValidator extends Validator<FormData> {\n  constructor() {\n    super();\n\n    this.ruleFor('username')\n      .notEmpty()\n      .withMessage('username is a required field');\n    this.ruleFor('password')\n      .notEmpty()\n      .withMessage('password is a required field');\n  }\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: SubmitHandler<FormData>;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const {\n    register,\n    formState: { errors },\n    handleSubmit,\n  } = useForm({\n    resolver: fluentValidationResolver(new FormDataValidator()), // Useful to check TypeScript regressions\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} />\n      {errors.username && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.username.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('password')} />\n      {errors.password && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.password.message}</span>}\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's validation with Yup and TypeScript's integration\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  expect(screen.queryAllByRole('alert')).toHaveLength(0);\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  expect(screen.getByText(/username is a required field/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(screen.getByText(/password is a required field/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(handleSubmit).not.toHaveBeenCalled();\n});\n"
                                      }
                                    ]
                                  }
                                ]
                              }
                            ]
                          },

                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport * as vest from 'vest';\nimport { vestResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_SYMBOL_MESSAGE = 'password must contain a symbol';\n\ninterface FormData {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\nconst validationSuite = vest.create('form', (data: FormData) => {\n  vest.test('username', USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE, () => {\n    vest.enforce(data.username).isNotEmpty();\n  });\n\n  vest.test('password', PASSWORD_SYMBOL_MESSAGE, () => {\n    vest.enforce(data.password).isNotEmpty();\n  });\n});\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: vestResolver(validationSuite),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Vest\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_SYMBOL_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },

                                      }
                                    ]
                                  }
                                ]
                              }
                            ]

tt from 'io-ts-types';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { ioTsResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\nconst schema = t.type({\n  username: tt.withMessage(tt.NonEmptyString, () => USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n  password: tt.withMessage(tt.NonEmptyString, () => PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE),\n});\n\ninterface FormData {\n  username: string;\n  password: string;\n}\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: ioTsResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with io-ts\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"

                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { JSONSchemaType } from 'ajv';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { ajvResolver } from '..';\n\nconst USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'username field is required';\nconst PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE = 'password field is required';\n\ntype FormData = { username: string; password: string };\n\nconst schema: JSONSchemaType<FormData> = {\n  type: 'object',\n  properties: {\n    username: {\n      type: 'string',\n      minLength: 1,\n      errorMessage: { minLength: USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE },\n    },\n    password: {\n      type: 'string',\n      minLength: 1,\n      errorMessage: { minLength: PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE },\n    },\n  },\n  required: ['username', 'password'],\n  additionalProperties: false,\n};\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const { register, handleSubmit } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: ajvResolver(schema),\n    shouldUseNativeValidation: true,\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} placeholder=\"username\" />\n\n      <input {...register('password')} placeholder=\"password\" />\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's native validation with Ajv\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  // username\n  let usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /username/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  let passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(\n    /password/i,\n  ) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe(USERNAME_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(false);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe(PASSWORD_REQUIRED_MESSAGE);\n\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i), 'joe');\n  await user.type(screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i), 'password');\n\n  // username\n  usernameField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/username/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(usernameField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(usernameField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n\n  // password\n  passwordField = screen.getByPlaceholderText(/password/i) as HTMLInputElement;\n  expect(passwordField.validity.valid).toBe(true);\n  expect(passwordField.validationMessage).toBe('');\n});\n"
                                      },

                                        "name": "Form.tsx",
                                        "type": "file",
                                        "content": "import { render, screen } from '@testing-library/react';\nimport user from '@testing-library/user-event';\nimport { JSONSchemaType } from 'ajv';\nimport React from 'react';\nimport { useForm } from 'react-hook-form';\nimport { ajvResolver } from '..';\n\ntype FormData = { username: string; password: string };\n\nconst schema: JSONSchemaType<FormData> = {\n  type: 'object',\n  properties: {\n    username: {\n      type: 'string',\n      minLength: 1,\n      errorMessage: { minLength: 'username field is required' },\n    },\n    password: {\n      type: 'string',\n      minLength: 1,\n      errorMessage: { minLength: 'password field is required' },\n    },\n  },\n  required: ['username', 'password'],\n  additionalProperties: false,\n};\n\ninterface Props {\n  onSubmit: (data: FormData) => void;\n}\n\nfunction TestComponent({ onSubmit }: Props) {\n  const {\n    register,\n    formState: { errors },\n    handleSubmit,\n  } = useForm<FormData>({\n    resolver: ajvResolver(schema), // Useful to check TypeScript regressions\n  });\n\n  return (\n    <form onSubmit={handleSubmit(onSubmit)}>\n      <input {...register('username')} />\n      {errors.username && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.username.message}</span>}\n\n      <input {...register('password')} />\n      {errors.password && <span role=\"alert\">{errors.password.message}</span>}\n\n      <button type=\"submit\">submit</button>\n    </form>\n  );\n}\n\ntest(\"form's validation with Ajv and TypeScript's integration\", async () => {\n  const handleSubmit = vi.fn();\n  render(<TestComponent onSubmit={handleSubmit} />);\n\n  expect(screen.queryAllByRole('alert')).toHaveLength(0);\n\n  await user.click(screen.getByText(/submit/i));\n\n  expect(screen.getByText(/username field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(screen.getByText(/password field is required/i)).toBeInTheDocument();\n  expect(handleSubmit).not.toHaveBeenCalled();\n});\n"
